cell.html: Signed as a rap group, it consists of solo Detroit -based artists Bizarre , Eminem , Kon Artis , Kuniva , and Swift , and were additionally signed with now deceased rapper Proof . As a group, they knew each other pre-success from the Hip Hop Shop, in Detroit, and were the first to be signed to the label. [2] In December 2007, Bizarre stated that D12 are working on their third album. [39]
cell.text: Signed as a rap group, it consists of solo Detroit -based artists Bizarre , Eminem , Kon Artis , Kuniva , and Swift , and were additionally signed with now deceased rapper Proof . As a group, they knew each other pre-success from the Hip Hop Shop, in Detroit, and were the first to be signed to the label. [2] In December 2007, Bizarre stated that D12 are working on their third album. [39]

cell.html: He was the first solo artist signed to Shady Records. This Detroit-based rapper was signed shortly after Bizarre got him the opportunity to freestyle for Eminem, and did so through the passenger window of Eminem's car. [4] Obie Trice is currently working on his third album, Bottom's Up . [40]
cell.text: He was the first solo artist signed to Shady Records. This Detroit-based rapper was signed shortly after Bizarre got him the opportunity to freestyle for Eminem, and did so through the passenger window of Eminem's car. [4] Obie Trice is currently working on his third album, Bottom's Up . [40]

cell.html: A New York -based rapper signed under Shady Records and Aftermath Entertainment. [6] 50 Cent has since also established his own label, G-Unit Records , [41] and is currently working on his fourth Shady/Aftermath album, Before I Self Destruct . [42]
cell.text: A New York -based rapper signed under Shady Records and Aftermath Entertainment. [6] 50 Cent has since also established his own label, G-Unit Records , [41] and is currently working on his fourth Shady/Aftermath album, Before I Self Destruct . [42]

cell.html: An Atlanta -based rapper who is in a joint venture deal with Shady/Aftermath, after he was heard through his mixtapes. [20] The rapper has since been working on his company, Global Music Movement (GMM), [43] as well as on his debut album, Statlanta . [20]
cell.text: An Atlanta -based rapper who is in a joint venture deal with Shady/Aftermath, after he was heard through his mixtapes. [20] The rapper has since been working on his company, Global Music Movement (GMM), [43] as well as on his debut album, Statlanta . [20]

cell.html: An Atlanta-based artist who joined Shady Records after being heard rapping as a feature on the tape of another artist, Aasim , in the presence of Riggs Morales, Shady Records' Director of A&R. [30] He's currently working on his debut album, A Brilliant Mistake . [44]
cell.text: An Atlanta-based artist who joined Shady Records after being heard rapping as a feature on the tape of another artist, Aasim , in the presence of Riggs Morales, Shady Records' Director of A&amp;R. [30] He's currently working on his debut album, A Brilliant Mistake . [44]

cell.html: An Orange County -based artist who got signed to the label after his demo tapes got heard. [31] The rapper has stated he had been wanting to get on the label since two years prior to the signing. He is currently working on his debut album, Loose Cannon . [37]
cell.text: An Orange County -based artist who got signed to the label after his demo tapes got heard. [31] The rapper has stated he had been wanting to get on the label since two years prior to the signing. He is currently working on his debut album, Loose Cannon . [37]

context.text: Shady Records - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Artist Year signed (Shady) Albums released More information

September saw the release of 50 Cent's third album with the label, Curtis , which was involved in a well publicized competition with rapper Kanye West , who had his third album, Graduation set for release on the same day.
In May 2007, Cashis released the eight-track The County Hound EP in an attempt to have people "fiend" for his music, or garner interest in it. The album was released as a limited edition EP.

This talk went on for several months. In the end, it was announced that Eminem was so impressed with the mixtape material that he had decided to make it an official album, called Eminem Presents the Re-Up . The album had been long anticipated, until it was released in early December 2006. The release had spawned the single " You Don't Know ", which featured 50 Cent, Lloyd Banks , and the latest signee Cashis.

2006 was also a big year for Shady Records as a whole. There had been talk from early in the year of Eminem having the label's roster on a mixtape with new material to be presented by DJ Whoo Kid and The Alchemist .

The album saw a change in Obie Trice's style, whose first album was considered to be a little light-hearted. Second Round's on Me was considered to be a more serious, dark album, mainly showing the grittiness of Obie Trice's life and surroundings.
Later in 2006, Obie Trice released his second album, Second Round's on Me . However, the album did not fare as well commercially as his debut, seemingly because of the state of the hip-hop industry.
In early 2006, West Coast rapper Cashis joined Shady Records. Cashis, is an Orange County -based rapper that was born in Chicago who had managed to get his demo/mixtape heard by Eminem.
2005 also saw the signing of Bobby Creekwater to the label, making him the sixth artist and the second Atlanta-based rapper.

entity.htmlSnippet:
ArtistYear signed(Shady) Albums releasedMore information
D1220002Signed as a rap group, it consists of solo Detroit-based artists Bizarre, Eminem, Kon Artis, Kuniva, and Swift, and were additionally signed with now deceased rapper Proof. As a group, they knew each other pre-success from the Hip Hop Shop, in Detroit, and were the first to be signed to the label.[2] In December 2007, Bizarre stated that D12 are working on their third album.[39]
Obie Trice20002He was the first solo artist signed to Shady Records. This Detroit-based rapper was signed shortly after Bizarre got him the opportunity to freestyle for Eminem, and did so through the passenger window of Eminem's car.[4] Obie Trice is currently working on his third album, Bottom's Up.[40]
50 Cent20023A New York-based rapper signed under Shady Records and Aftermath Entertainment.[6] 50 Cent has since also established his own label, G-Unit Records,[41] and is currently working on his fourth Shady/Aftermath album, Before I Self Destruct.[42]
Stat Quo2003—An Atlanta-based rapper who is in a joint venture deal with Shady/Aftermath, after he was heard through his mixtapes.[20] The rapper has since been working on his company, Global Music Movement (GMM),[43] as well as on his debut album, Statlanta.[20]
Bobby Creekwater2005—An Atlanta-based artist who joined Shady Records after being heard rapping as a feature on the tape of another artist, Aasim, in the presence of Riggs Morales, Shady Records' Director of A&R.[30] He's currently working on his debut album, A Brilliant Mistake.[44]
Cashis20061An Orange County-based artist who got signed to the label after his demo tapes got heard.[31] The rapper has stated he had been wanting to get on the label since two years prior to the signing. He is currently working on his debut album, Loose Cannon.[37]
